task_summary: Place the currently held maroon object down on the table and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator interacts with several small tabletop objects (green bottle, blue can, clear cup, orange toy coil, and a maroon rectangular block). The instruction is to put down the maroon object. In the frames, the gripper already holds the maroon block and moves toward the right-side open surface, lowers, releases, and backs away. The behavior emphasizes safe contact with the table, a gentle release, and a short retreat to clear the object while avoiding nearby items.
preconditions: Maroon object is already grasped by the gripper
Clear table area exists for placing
Perception available to confirm the held object
stepwise_plan: Verify the maroon object is in the gripper.
Move above the intended table placement area with small vertical offset.
Lower until light contact with the surface is detected.
Open the gripper to release the maroon object.
Wait briefly to ensure stable settling.
Retreat a short distance to clear the object.
success_criteria: Maroon object resting stably on the table surface
End-effector safely clear of surrounding objects
failure_and_recovery: Contact not detected: retry the gentle lowering once more or adjust approach height.
Object sticks to fingers: open gripper further and add a slight vertical jiggle (not modeled here).
Placement area obstructed: shift laterally and reattempt lowering.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate once the object is released, no longer in the gripper, and the robot has retreated to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: Lowering motion with the maroon block aligned over the place spot.

frame_5.now_evidence: Open gripper/release phase; object about to be left on surface.
frame_5.predicts_next: Short wait then retreat ensures stability.

frame_6.now_evidence: End-effector retracts with object resting on table.

node_specs.description: Verify the maroon object is currently held.
Move above the table placement area with a small vertical offset.
Descend gently until contact with the surface is detected.
Allow the object to settle after release.
Back away to a safe clearance.

failure_modes: No surface contact detected within max depth
Object not released due to adhesion
Collision with nearby objects during retreat
recovery_strategy: Re-approach from slightly higher offset and retry lowering
Increase gripper opening and add a brief wait
assumptions: The maroon object corresponds to the red/maroon rectangular block visible in frames.
The object is already grasped at episode start (as suggested by frames 3â€“6).
Placement surface is the tabletop near the right side, clear of obstacles.

expected_success_criteria: Object released on table and gripper empty
Robot safely retracted without disturbing neighbors
